description.text: Ideas are well-constructed and well-thought-out. The responses are based upon the assigned materials or activities and show depth of thought and effort. Post meets requirement for length and content.
Ideas show some depth of thought. The responses make some reference to the assigned materials or activities, but there is room for improvement. Requirement for length and content are not fully met.
Weak responses. Ideas are mostly rambling and show little relevance to the assignment's instructions. Requirement for length and content are not met.
Assignment was either turned in too late or not turned in.

All response posts build upon what others have shared, offer insightful feedback/comments, and/or ask thought-provoking questions. Posts draw upon principles learned in the readings and not simply common sense. Posts meets requirement for length and content.

Response posts partially build upon what others have shared. Feedback, comments, and/or questions are somewhat insightful and/or thought-provoking. Posts draw upon some principles learned in the readings. Post meets requirement for length and content.

Response posts do not build upon what others have shared. Feedback, comments, and/or questions are not insightful and/or thought-provoking. Posts do not draw upon principles learned in the readings. Requirement for length and content are not met.
Assignment was either turned in too late or not turned in.
Grammar, punctuation, and spelling are correct. There are few, if any, mistakes and the posts are easily readable.
Grammar, punctuation, and spelling are mostly correct, but there are some errors. There are some mistakes, but they do not affect readability.
There are frequent mistakes in grammar ,punctuation, or spelling. These errors make it somewhat difficult to understand the posts. There is room for improvement.
Assignment was either turned in too late or not turned in.
No attempt was made at proper grammar, spelling, or punctuation.
Every sentence contains a spelling or grammar error significant enough to require rereading.
Multiple grammar and/or spelling errors which required rereading entire sentences.
One or two places were unclear due to grammar and/or spelling.
No impediment to comprehension due to grammar or spelling.  No obvious spelling errors.
Less than 50 or more than 300 words
Less than 150 or more than 200 words
150-200 words long
Essay shows minimal understanding of article concepts.  Discussion of the science involved contains many errors.
Essay shows weak understanding of article concepts.  Discussion of the science involved contains at least one significant error.
Essay shows adequate understanding of article concepts.  Discussion of the science involved contains minor errors.
Essay shows good understanding of article concepts.  Discussion of the science involved contains only insignificant errors.
Essay shows strong understanding of article concepts.  Discussion of the science involved contains no errors.
Essay makes minimal connections between article and the scientific process.  No examples are used.
Essay makes weak connections between article and the scientific process.  Examples used don't support point being made.
Essay makes decent connections between article and the scientific process.  Examples used are not immediately obvious.
Essay makes good connections between article and the scientific process.  Examples used are clear.
Essay makes unique connections between article and the scientific process.  Examples used are clear and insightful.
No citation.
Citation is just a website.
Article author or publication is not immediately obvious in citation.
Citation clear and easily followed.
Citation clear and easily followed; a link is included.
No attempt was made at proper grammar, spelling, or punctuation.  Less than 40 words.
Every sentence contains a spelling or grammar error significant enough to require rereading.  40-50 words.
Multiple grammar and/or spelling errors which required rereading entire sentences.  50 words or more, but comment three or higher.
One or two places were unclear due to grammar and/or spelling.  50 words or more, and first or second comment.
No impediment to comprehension due to grammar or spelling.  No obvious spelling errors.  50 words or more, and first or second comment.
General comments that could be applied to any post.
Comments reflect cursory reading of original post.  No personal application is evident.
Comments reflect thoughtful reading of original post, but are somewhat general.
Comments reflect thoughtful reading of original post and are specific to this post.
Comments reflect thoughtful reading of original post and are specific to this post.  Personal application is expressed.
No attempt was made at proper grammar, spelling, or punctuation.  Less than 30 words.
Every sentence contains a spelling or grammar error significant enough to require rereading.  30-40 words.
Multiple grammar and/or spelling errors which required rereading entire sentences.  40-50 words.
One or two places were unclear due to grammar and/or spelling.  50 words or more.
No impediment to comprehension due to grammar or spelling.  No obvious spelling errors.  50 words or more.
General responses that could be applied to any comment.
Responses reflect cursory reading of comments.  No personal application is evident.
Responses reflect thoughtful reading of comments, but are somewhat general.
Responses reflect thoughtful reading of comments.  Personal application is expressed.
Responses reflect thoughtful reading of comments.  Constructive criticism is earnestly considered and internalized.
Free of grammatical or spelling errors. (30 pts)
Report contained one or two grammatical or spelling errors. (5 pts)
Report reads like it was written by a scruffy looking nerf herder. (0 pts)
Report synthesized the concepts taught in Unit 1 and drew interesting conclusions to the discussion questions. (30 pts)
Report covered one or two of the topics from Unit 1 and adequately explained their relevance in today's world. (15 pts)
The report did not cover the topics from Unit 1 or shows a general misunderstanding of the principles taught in the Unit. (0 pts)
Assignment was submitted on time for full credit. (10 pts)
Assignment was submitted up to 48 hours late or previous arrangements were made with instructor for late work. (5 pts)
Assignment was submitted late without appropriate communication or arrangements made. (0 pts)

(14 - 15 points) Ideas are well-constructed and well-thought-out. The responses are based upon the assigned materials or activities and show depth of thought and effort. Post meets requirement for length and content.

(12 - 13 points) Ideas show some depth of thought. The responses make some reference to the assigned materials or activities, but there is room for improvement. Requirement for length and content are not fully met.
(8-11 points) Weak responses. Ideas are mostly rambling and show little relevance to the assignment's instructions. Requirement for length and content are not met.
(0 points) Assignment was either turned in too late or not turned in.

(9 - 10 points) All response posts build upon what others have shared, offer insightful feedback/comments, and/or ask thought-provoking questions. Posts draw upon principles learned in the readings and not simply common sense. Posts meets requirement for length and content.

(7 - 8 points) Response posts partially build upon what others have shared. Feedback, comments, and/or questions are somewhat insightful and/or thought-provoking. Posts draw upon some principles learned in the readings. Post meets requirement for length and content.

(5 - 6 points) Response posts do not build upon what others have shared. Feedback, comments, and/or questions are not insightful and/or thought-provoking. Posts do not draw upon principles learned in the readings. Requirement for length and content are not met.
(0 points) Assignment was either turned in too late or not turned in.
(5 points) Grammar, punctuation, and spelling are correct. There are few, if any, mistakes and the posts are easily readable.
(4 points) Grammar, punctuation, and spelling are mostly correct, but there are some errors. There are some mistakes, but they do not affect readability.
(3 points) There are frequent mistakes in grammar ,punctuation, or spelling. These errors make it somewhat difficult to understand the posts. There is room for improvement.
(0 points) Assignment was either turned in too late or not turned in.
Report synthesized the concepts taught in Unit 1 and drew interesting conclusions to the discussion questions. (30 pts)
Report covered one or two of the topics from Unit 1 and adequately explained their relevance in today's world. (15 pts)
The report did not cover the topics from Unit 1 or shows a general misunderstanding of the principles taught in the Unit. (0 pts)
The report was free of grammatical or spelling errors. (10 pts)
Report contained one or two grammatical or spelling errors. (5 pts)
Report reads like it was written by a scruffy Nerf Herder. (0 pts)
Assignment was submitted on time for full credit. (10 pts)
Assignment was submitted up to 48 hours late or previous arrangements were made with instructor for late work. (5 pts)
Assignment was submitted late without appropriate communication or arrangements made. (0 pts)

criterion.name: What planet are you from? (2 points)
What color is your lightsaber if you have one; if you do not have one, what color would you like? (2 points)
How long is your Padawan brain in inches? (2 points)
What is the name of your favorite Jedi Master? (2 points)
